reference_summary:
{'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Producers': ['Kris Greengrove', 'Susan Holden', 'Steve Oakes', 'David Starr', 'Richard Winkler', 'Soo Kim', 'Jennifer Twomey', 'Marcy Pritchard', 'Amy Steinberg', 'Max Goodman'], 'Studio': ['CBS']} Such a cute show, my 4 old loves it! I've noticed she developed an interest in math and patterns after starting this show...love that! Fun and catchy songs! Jurassic Park Collection (Jurassic Park / The Lost World: Jurassic Park / Jurassic Park III / Jurassic World) Jeff Goldblum (Actor), Chris Pratt (Actor), Colin Trevorrow (Director, Writer), Joe Johnston (Director) & 1 more Rated: PG-13 Format: Blu-ray Movies & TV, Blu-ray, Movies ['Steven Spielberg returns to executive produce the long-awaited next installment of his groundbreaking Jurassic Park series, Jurassic World, an epic action-adventure.'] {'Aspect Ratio': '2.20:1, 2:1, 1.85:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'PG-13 (Parents Strongly Cautioned)', 'Product Dimensions': '7.5 x 5.75 x 1 inches; 11.2 Ounces', 'Item model number': '35222591', 'Director': 'Colin Trevorrow, Joe Johnston, Steven Spielberg', 'Media Format': 'Box set, Color, Widescreen, Blu-ray, Digital_copy', 'Run time': '12 hours and 6 minutes', 'Release date': 'October 20, 2015', 'Actors': 'Jeff Goldblum, Chris Pratt, Sam Neill, Laura Dern, Bryce Dallas Howard', 'Subtitles': 'French, Spanish', 'Producers': 'Frank Marshall, Steven Spielberg, Patrick Crowley, Larry Franco, Kathleen Kennedy', 'Language': 'English (DTS-HD Master Audio 5.1), French (Dolby Digital 5.1), Spanish (Dolby Digital 5.1), English (DTS-HD 2.0), French (DTS 5.1), French Canadian (DTS 5.1), Spanish (DTS 5.1)', 'Studio': 'Universal Pictures Home Entertainment', 'Writers': 'Rick Jaffa, Amanda Silver, Peter Buchman, Derek Connolly, Colin Trevorrow', 'Number of discs': '6'} We have had this set for a while now and it's great! I'm sorry, I'm not a person that knows all the tech details but from my perspective it's
the picture quality, value and the nerd factor of having the collection🤓🐊 from my perspective it's the picture quality, value and the nerd factor {'Audio languages': ['English Dialogue Boost: High', 'English', 'English [Audio Description]', 'English Dialogue Boost: Medium', 'English Dialogue Boost: Low', 'Italiano', '한국어', '日本語', 'العربية', 'Português', 'Nederlands', 'Deutsch', 'Русский', 'हिन्दी', 'Español (España)', 'Indonesia', 'Español (Latinoamérica)', 'Polski', 'Türkçe', '中文（台灣）', '中文（中国）', 'Français'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]', 'العربية', 'Deutsch', 'Español (Latinoamérica)', 'Español (España)', 'Français', 'हिन्दी', 'Indonesia', 'Italiano', '日本語', '한국어', 'Nederlands', 'Polski', 'Português', 'Русский', 'Türkçe', '中文（简体）', '中文（繁體）'], 'Directors': ['Cam Lizotte', 'Nico Rijgersberg', 'Jay Silver', 'Joshua Young', 'Gilly Fogg'], 'Producers': ['Kristen Newlands', 'Phillip Stamp', 'Dr. Alice Wilder', 'Steven Denure', 'Shevaun Gray', 'Anne Loi', 'Margaret Harrison', 'Wendy Harris', 'Samantha Freeman'], 'Starring': ['DevanCohen', 'Ava Close', 'Elizabeth Hanna'], 'Studio': ['Amazon Studios']} I do think it's a cute show and I like that it's clean and sweet. My 7 year old loves it!

But the singing reeeeeaallly gets to me. I wondered if I was the only one but I see from other season/episode reviews that I'm not🤔

Other than that, it's worthy of 5 stars, in my opinion🙄 Sorry but the singing makes me want to rate it much lower {'Audio languages': ['English', 'English [Audio Description]'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Walt Dohrn'], 'Producers': ['Gina Shay'], 'Starring': ['Sam Rockwell', 'Caroline Hjelt', 'Anthony Ramos'], 'Studio': ['Universal Pictures']} I think most Trolls fans will love it (definitely the kiddos). I like the message it gives about people in our world (well their world) being different but we still need each other. I don't have much that I don't like about it. Overall love it and the music but the 2 things I feel are slight, personal disappointments:

-Renting price: Mixed feelings. Had we seen it in theater we would have easily spent 3 times the amount for one showing (at a dine-in theater) so that's definitely cheaper...but, I guess I had in my mind it was going to be like Onward and have the ability to rent or buy. I'm thankful for the ability to see it since we had been excited for it for while...and a bit of fun to a difficult time. But we likely won't be able to rent it again after this time. So mixed feelings- thankful for the ability of watching it…but also kind of bummed that it still feels a bit expensive, during this time, to rent it. No one made me rent it though still sharing my personal viewpoint 🤔

-Second: I'm not really strict about kids movies but I am getting tired of kids movies having butt jokes/showing butts… of course it cracks my kiddo up lol ugh BUT why is it necessary😒 There's not too much in this one- I think there were just a couple, still though...there are many other ways to make them laugh!

ANYWAY, off my soapbox now. I did actually love the movie. We're currently watching it for the third time. My 9 year old is for sure enjoying it! We're loving it! Though a little mixed feelings about renting {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'alcohol use', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English Dialogue Boost: High', 'English', 'English [Audio Description]', 'English Dialogue Boost: Medium'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Jake Kasdan'], 'Producers': ['Matt Tolmach', 'William Teitler'], 'Starring': ['Dwayne Johnson', 'Kevin Hart', 'Jack Black'], 'Studio': ['SONY PICTURES ENTERTAINMENT', 'INC.']} I refused to watch this for years (Idk why, I like all the actors a lot) but then my daughter got me to finally watch it and I ended up really liking it. I was laughing a lot throughout it. Surprisingly interesting! Didn't want to see it Ghostbusters Science Fiction, Comedy, Eerie, Joyous ['Ghosts invade New York and force a trio of spirit exterminators to save the city in one of the biggest comedies of all time. Bill Murray, Dan Aykroyd and Sigourney Weaver head the all-star cast.'] {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'frightening scenes', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Ivan Reitman'], 'Producers': ['Ivan Reitman'], 'Starring': ['Bill Murray', 'Casey Kasem', 'Dan Aykroyd']} No issues with streaming which made it extra-enjoyable to watch 😄 Never gets old!
profile:
The user maintains a strong inclination toward engaging, educational content for young children, specifically programs merging music and learning, particularly in math and patterns. Their child's burgeoning interest in math informs this focus on educational value, while a preference for family-friendly shows featuring enjoyable songs persists. Despite consistently high ratings for quality programming, the user has recently begun adopting a more critical perspective regarding content quality.

In their latest review, they praised a children's film that delivered a valuable message about diversity and connection, even though they noted concerns regarding the rental price and certain immature humor. However, their overall enjoyment resulted in a high rating, underscoring their appreciation for quality, relatable content resonating with both children and parents.

Additionally, the user has expanded their viewing habits to include adult-oriented content that emphasizes exceptional picture quality and intellectual depth, reflecting a desire for entertainment that fosters family discussions. This shift showcases their evolving tastes while still prioritizing entertaining, educational, and high-quality programming for all ages. They remain discerning regarding content that doesn't meet their elevated standards, valuing a mix of fun, learning, and meaningful narratives in their media choices. Their recent interaction with a classic film reinforces their enjoyment of timeless comedies that continue to captivate.
